revisions.rev:
{{Israeli people}} This is a '''list of notable [[Israelis|Israeli]] [[Ashkenazi Jews]]''', including both original immigrants who obtained Israeli citizenship and their Israeli descendants.
It should be noted that although traditionally the term "Ashkenazi Jews" was used as an all encompassing term referring to the Jews descended from the Jewish communities of Europe, due to the [[Melting pot#Israel|melting pot affect of the Israeli society]] the term "Ashkenazi Jews" gradually becomes more vague as many of the Israeli descendants of the Ashkenazi Jews immigrants gradually adopted the characteristics of the Israeli culture and as more decedents intermarry with descendants of other Jewish communities.
The list is ordered by category of human endeavor. Persons with significant contributions in two fields are listed in both of the pertinent categories, to facilitate easy lookup.
==Politicians== * [[Chaim Weizmann]] â first [[President of Israel]] (1949â52) * [[Yitzhak Ben-Zvi]] â first elected/second president [[President of Israel]] (1952â63) * [[David Ben-Gurion]] â first [[Prime Minister of Israel]] (1948â54, 1955â63) * [[Moshe Sharett]] â prime minister (1954â55) * [[Levi Eshkol]] â prime minister (1963â69) * [[Golda Meir]] â prime minister (1969â74) * [[Yitzhak Rabin]] â prime minister (1974â77, 1992â95); [[Nobel Peace Prize]] (1994) (assassinated November 1995) * [[Menachem Begin]] â prime minister (1977â83); Nobel Peace Prize (1978) * [[Yitzhak Shamir]] â prime minister (1983â84, 1986â92) * [[Shimon Peres]] â [[President of Israel]] (2007â); prime minister (1984â86, 1995â96); Nobel Peace Prize (1994) * [[Benjamin Netanyahu]] â prime minister (1996â99), (2009â); was minister of finance; Likud party chairman * [[Ehud Barak]] â prime minister (1999â01) * [[Moshe Katsav]] â president (2000â07) * [[Ariel Sharon]] â prime minister (2001â06) * [[Ehud Olmert]] â prime minister (2006â09); former mayor of Jerusalem * [[Rehavam Zeevi]] â founder of the Moledet party (assassinated October 2001) * [[Yossi Beilin]] â leader of the [[Meretz-Yachad]] party and peace negotiator * [[Yosef Lapid]] â former leader of the [[Shinui]] party * [[Teddy Kollek]] â former mayor of [[Jerusalem]] * [[Effie Eitam]] â former leader of the [[National Religious Party]] party, now head of the [[Renewed Religious National Zionist party]]
<gallery widths="180px" heights="150px" perrow=4> File:David bengurion2.JPG|[[David Ben-Gurion]] File:Portrait Teddy Kollek portrait.jpg|[[Teddy Kollek]] File:ChaimWeizmann1948.jpg|[[Chaim Weizmann]] File:Yitzhak Rabin (1986) cropped.jpg|[[Yitzhak Rabin]] File:Menachem Begin 2.jpg|[[Menachem Begin]] File:Golda Meir 03265u.jpg|[[Golda Meir]] File:Ariel Sharon 2001.jpg|[[Ariel Sharon]] File:Benjamin Netanyahu portrait.jpg|[[Benjamin Netanyahu]] </gallery>
==Military== * [[Wolfgang Lotz]] â spy * [[Moshe Dayan]] â military leader * [[Giora Epstein]] â combat pilot, modern-day "[[flying ace|ace of aces]]" * [[Uziel Gal]] â designer of the [[Uzi]] submachine gun * [[Peter Malkin|Tzvi Malkhin]] â [[Mossad]] agent, captured [[Adolf Eichmann]] * [[Yonatan Netanyahu]] â [[Sayeret Matkal]] commando, leader of [[Operation Entebbe]] * [[Ilan Ramon]] â astronaut on [[Space Shuttle Columbia|Columbia]] flight [[STS-107]] * [[Gilad Shalit]] â kidnapped soldier held in Gaza * [[Yitzhak Rabin]] â military leader and 5th Prime Minister of Israel * [[Yigal Allon]] â politician, a commander of the [[Palmach]], and a general in the [[Israel Defense Forces|IDF]]. * [[Benny Gantz]] â current Chief of General Staff of the Israel Defense Forces * [[Yael Rom]] â the first female to graduate from a full military flight course in the [[Western world]] in general and in the Israeli Air Force in particular.
<gallery widths="180px" heights="150px" perrow=4> File:Yigal Allon.jpg|[[Yigal Allon]] File:Moshe Dayan.jpg|[[Moshe Dayan]] File:Uzi Gal.jpg|[[Uziel Gal]] File:Rabin Northern Command1957.jpg|[[Yitzhak Rabin]] File:Ilan Ramon, NASA photo portrait in orange suit.jpg|[[Ilan Ramon]] File:Benny Gantz portrait.jpg|[[Benny Gantz]] File:Gilad Shalit portrait.jpg|[[Gilad Shalit]] </gallery>
==Religious figures== ===Religious-Zionist rabbis=== [[File:Rabbilau.jpg|thumb|right|[[Israel Meir Lau]]]] * [[Avraham Yitzchak Kook]], pre-state Ashkenazic Chief Rabbi of the Land of Israel,<ref>Even though the State of Israel did not yet exist at the time of his death, he is commonly referred to as the first Ashkenazic Chief Rabbi of the State of Israel.</ref> (1865â1935) * [[Yona Metzger]], Ashkenazic Chief Rabbi of Israel * [[Israel Meir Lau]] Ashkenazic Chief Rabbi of Israel (1993â2003), Chief Rabbi of Netanya (1978â88), (1937â) * [[Aharon Lichtenstein]] * [[David Hartman (rabbi)|David Hartman]] * [[Shlomo Riskin ]] Ashkenazic Chief Rabbi of Efrat
===Haredi rabbis=== [[File:×××¨× ××××¨.jpg|thumb|right|[[Uri Zohar]]]] * [[Uri Zohar]] â former film director, actor, and comedian who left the entertainment world to become a rabbi * [[Avraham Yeshayeh Karelitz]], ''Chazon Ish'', (1878â1953) * [[Elazar Menachem Shach]], ''Rav Shach'', (1899â2001) * [[Moshe Shmuel Shapira]], [[rosh yeshiva]] of Beer Yaakov * [[Nissim Karelitz]], Head Justice of Rabbinical Court of [[Bnei Brak]] * [[Chaim Kanievsky]] * [[Yosef Sholom Eliashiv]] * [[Shlomo Zalman Auerbach]] * [[Yosef Chaim Sonnenfeld]], Chief Rabbi of Jerusalem ([[Edah HaChareidis]]) * [[Yitzchok Tuvia Weiss]], Chief Rabbi of Jerusalem ([[Edah HaChareidis]]) * [[Yosef Tzvi Dushinsky (I)]], Chief Rabbi of Jerusalem ([[Edah HaChareidis]]) * [[Yaakov Aryeh Alter]], [[Ger (Hasidic dynasty)|Gerrer]] Rebbe * [[Yissachar Dov Rokeach (II)]], [[Belz (Hasidic dynasty)|Belzer]] Rebbe
==Activists== [[File:Natan Shernasky1.JPG|thumb|180px|right|[[Natan Sharansky]]]] * [[Natan Sharansky]] â Soviet-era human rights activist * [[Uri Avnery]] â peace activist, [[Gush Shalom]] * [[Yael Dayan]] â writer, politician, activist * [[Michael Dorfman]] Russian-Israeli essayist and human rights activist * [[Uzi Even]] â gay rights activist * [[Uri Savir]], peace negotiator, [[Peres Center for Peace]] * [[Israel Shahak]] â political activist * [[Daphni Leef]] â Israeli activist in 2011 sparked off [[2011 housing protests in Israel|one of the largest waves of mass protest in Israel's history]].

==Academic figures== ===Physics and chemistry=== [[File:Shechtman.jpg|thumb|right|180px|[[Dan Shechtman]]]] * [[Dan Shechtman]] â [[quasicrystal]]s; Wolf Prize in Physics (1999). He was awarded the 2011 [[Nobel Prize in Chemistry]] for "the discovery of quasicrystals".<ref name="nobel">{{cite web|url=http://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/chemistry/laureates/2011/shechtman.html |title=Dan Shechtman â Biographical |publisher=Nobelprize.org |date= |accessdate=2011-10-05}}</ref>) * [[Yakir Aharonov]] â [[Aharonov-Bohm effect]]; [[Wolf Prize in Physics]] (1998) * [[Jacob Bekenstein]] â black hole thermodynamics * [[David Deutsch]] â quantum computing pioneer; [[Dirac Prize|Paul Dirac Prize]] (1998) * [[Joshua Jortner]] and [[Raphael David Levine|Rafi Levine]] â molecular energy; [[Wolf Prize in Chemistry]] (1988) * [[Josef Imry]], physicist * [[Aaron Katzir]], physical chemistry, * [[Ephraim Katzir]] â immobilized enzymes; [[Japan Prize]] (1985) The fourth President of Israel [[List of Presidents of Israel]] * [[Zvi Lipkin]], physicist * [[Mordehai Milgrom]] â Modified Newtonian Dynamics ([[Modified Newtonian Dynamics|MOND]]) * [[Yuval Ne'eman]] â the "[[Eightfold way (physics)|Eightfold way]]" * [[Asher Peres]] â quantum theory * [[Giulio Racah]] â spectroscopy * [[Nathan Rosen]] â EPR paradox * [[Nathan Seiberg]] â string theory * [[Igal Talmi]], particle physics * [[Reshef Tenne]] â discovered inorganic fullerenes and [[inorganic nanotube]]s * [[Chaim Weizmann]] â acetone production
===Biology and medicine=== [[File:Nobel2004chemistrylaurets-Ciehanover.jpg|thumb|160px|[[Aaron Ciechanover]]]] [[File:AdaYonath.jpg|thumb|160px|[[Ada Yonath]]]] * [[Aaron Ciechanover]] and [[Avram Hershko]] â ubiquitin system; [[Albert Lasker Award for Basic Medical Research|Lasker Award]] (2000), [[Nobel Prize in Chemistry]] (2004) * [[Moshe Feldenkrais]] â invented [[Feldenkrais method]] used in movement therapy * [[Lior Gepstein]] â American College of Cardiology's Zipes Award for his development of heart cells and pacemakers from stem cells.<ref name="ynetnews1">{{cite web | url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3395347,00.html | title=The World Salutes Four Israeli Scientists | accessdate=2007-05-05}}</ref> * [[Eyal Gur]] â selected by [[Newsweek]] as one of the world's top microsurgeons <ref name="ynetnews1"/> * [[Hossam Haick]] â inventor of an electric nose for diagnosis of cancer <ref name="ynetnews1"/> * [[Israel Hanukoglu]] â structures of cytoskeletal keratins, NADP binding proteins, steroidogenic enzymes, Epithelial Sodium Channels (ENaC) * [[Gavriel Iddan]] â inventor of capsule endoscopy * [[Benjamin Kahn]] â marine biologist, defender of the Red Sea reef * [[Gideon Mer]] â malaria control *[[Andy Lehrer]], entomologist * [[Shulamit Levenberg]] â inventor of a muscle tissue which isn't rejected by the body after transplant. Selected by Scientific American as one of the 50 leading scientists in the world.<ref name="ynetnews1"/> * [[Alexander Levitzki]] â cancer research; [[Wolf Prize in Medicine]] (2005) * [[Saul Merin]] â Ophthalmologist, author of Inherited Eye Diseases * [[Raphael Mechoulam]] â Chemist, discoverer of [[tetrahydrocannabinol]] and [[anandamide]] * [[Leo Sachs]] â blood cell research; Wolf Prize in Medicine (1980) * [[Michael Sela]] and [[Ruth Arnon]] â developed [[Copaxone]]; Wolf Prize in Medicine (1998) * [[Joel Sussman]] â 3D structure of acetylcholinesterase, Elkeles Prize for Research in Medicine (2005) *[[Valero Aaron]]-Professor of Medicine, founder of Faculty of Medicine at the Technion, director of government hospital * [[Meir Wilchek]] â affinity chromatography; Wolf Prize in Medicine (1987) * [[Ada Yonath]] â structure of ribosome. She received the Nobel Prize in Chemistry (2009) * [[Amotz Zahavi]] â [[Handicap Principle]]
===Social sciences=== [[File:Daniel KAHNEMAN.jpg|thumb|160px|[[Daniel Kahneman]]]] * [[Yehuda Bauer]] â historian * [[Haim Ginott]] â psychologist: child psychology * [[Eliyahu Goldratt]] â business consultant: [[Theory of Constraints]] * [[Louis Guttman]] â sociologist * [[Elhanan Helpman]] â economist: international trade * [[Daniel Kahneman]] â behavioural scientist: [[prospect theory]]; [[Bank of Sweden Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel|Nobel Prize in Economics]] (2002) * [[Smadar Lavie]] â anthropologist * [[Amihai Mazar]] â archaeologist * [[Benjamin Mazar]] â archaeologist * [[Eilat Mazar]] â archaeologist * [[Benny Morris]] and [[Avi Shlaim]] â historians: [[New Historians]] * [[Erich Neumann (psychologist)|Erich Neumann]] â analytical psychologist: development, consciousness * [[Nurit Peled-Elhanan]] â educator * [[Sheizaf Rafaeli]] â Management, information, communication, * [[Ariel Rubinstein]] â economist * [[Amos Tversky]] â behavioral scientist: [[prospect theory]] with [[Daniel Kahneman]] * [[Yigael Yadin]] â archaeologist * [[Daniel Elazar]] â political science

Hamming Medal]] (2007 and 1995) * [[Joram Lindenstrauss]] â mathematician [[JohnsonâLindenstrauss lemma]] * [[Elon Lindenstrauss]] â mathematician [[the 2010 Fields Medal awarded]] * [[Michel LoÃ¨ve]] â probabilist * [[Joel Moses]] â MIT provost and writer of [[Macsyma]] * [[Yoram Moses]] â computer scientist, winner of the(1997) * [[Judea Pearl]] â artificial intelligence, philosophy of action * [[Ilya Piatetski-Shapiro]] â representation theory; [[Wolf Prize in Mathematics]] (1990) * [[Amir Pnueli]] â temporal logic; [[Turing Award]] (1996) * [[Shmuel Safra]] â computer scientist, winner of the (2001) * [[Nir Shavit]]- computer scientist, winner of the (2001) * [[Michael O. ==Entrepreneurs== ===High-tech=== [[File:Andi Gutmans 1.jpg|thumb| right| 160px |[[Andi Gutmans]]]] [[File:Yossi Vardi, 2005.jpg|thumb| right| 160px |[[Yossi Vardi]]]] * [[Beny Alagem]] â founder of [[Packard Bell]] * [[Moshe Bar]] â founder of [[XenSource]], [[Qumranet]] * [[Safra Catz]] â president of [[Oracle Corporation|Oracle]] * [[Yossi Gross]] â recipient of almost 600 patents, founder of 27 medical technology companies in Israel and the Chief Technology Office officer of Rainbow Medical. * [[Daniel M. Lewin]] â founder of [[Akamai Technologies]] * [[Bob Rosenschein]] â founder of [[GuruNet]], [[Answers.com]] (Israeli-based) * [[Gil Schwed]] â founder of [[Check Point Software Technologies|Check Point]] * [[Zeev Suraski]] and [[Andi Gutmans]] â founders of [[Zend Technologies]] (developers of [[PHP]]) * [[Arik Vardi|Ariki]] and [[Yossi Vardi]], [[Yair Goldfinger]], [[Sefi Vigiser]] and [[Amnon Amir]] â founders of [[Mirabilis (company)|Mirabilis]] (developers of [[ICQ]])
===Other=== * [[Ted Arison|Ted]], [[Micky Arison|Micky]] and [[Shari Arison]] â founder/owners of [[Carnival Corporation]] * [[Eli Hurvitz]] â head of [[Teva Pharmaceutical Industries|Teva Pharmaceuticals]] * [[Mordecai Meirowitz]] â inventor of the [[Mastermind (board game)|Mastermind]] board game * [[Sammy Ofer]] â shipping magnate * [[Yuli Ofer]] - businessman whom specialized in the field of real estate and industry * [[Stef Wertheimer]] â industrialist
==Sports== ===Association Football=== [[File:Wallach stelmach.jpg|thumb|210px|[[Yochanan Vollach]] (right), shaking hands with [[Nahum Stelmach]]]] * [[Ronnie Rosenthal]] â left winger/striker (national team), Maccabi Haifa, Liverpool, Tottenham, Watford<ref>{{cite book|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=gkt_DYq1b7kC&pg=PA97&dq=%22Ronnie+Rosenthal%22+jewish&hl=en&ei=5mEUTc_nNcKqlAfzx4HfCw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=6&ved=0CD4Q6AEwBQ#v=onepage&q=%22Ronnie%20Rosenthal%22%20jewish&f=false |title=Welcome to the Terrordome: the pain, politics, and promise of sports|author=Dave Zirin, Chuck D|publisher=Haymarket Books |ISBN=1931859418 |year= 2007|accessdate=December 24, 2010}}</ref> * [[Mordechai Spiegler]], Soviet Union/Israel â striker (Israel national team), manager * [[Eyal Berkovic]] â midfielder (national team), Maccabi Haifa, Southampton, West Ham United, Celtic, Manchester City, Portsmouth * [[Yochanan Vollach]] â defender (national team), Maccabi Haifa, Hapoel Haifa, HKFC; current president of [[Maccabi Haifa F.C.|Maccabi Haifa]]<ref>{{http://www.hapoelhaifa.com/site/modules.php?name=Content&pa=showpage&pid=3 |title=Hapoel Haifa's Hall of fame|author=Yossef Glazer|ISBN=1931859418|year= 2006}}</ref>
* [[Giora Spiegel]] - midfielder (national team), [[Maccabi Tel Aviv]] * [[Nahum Stelmach]] - striker (national team)

Bluthenthal's late mother was Jewish and his father is blackâthe family name Bluthenthal originated with a slave owner David Bluthenthal believes was German-Jewish."</ref> * [[Tal Brody]] â US & Israel, Euroleague 6' 2" [[shooting guard]], [[Maccabi Tel-Aviv (basketball)|Maccabi Tel-Aviv]] * [[Tal Burstein]] â [[Maccabi Tel-Aviv (basketball)|Maccabi Tel-Aviv]] * [[Omri Casspi]] â 6' 9" small forward, drafted in 1st round of [[2009 NBA Draft]] ([[Cleveland Cavaliers]])<ref name="jweekly2">{{cite news|url=http://www.jweekly.com/article/full/41080/jews-and-mel-on-the-big-screen-winter-sports-roundup/|author=Nate Bloom |title=Jews (and Mel) on the big screen, Winter sports roundup |publisher=Jweekly |date=January 21, 2010 |accessdate=May 13, 2010}}</ref> * [[Tanhum Cohen-Mintz]], Latvian-born Israeli, 6' 8" center; traded to [[Houston Rockets]]), but completing mandatory [[Israel Defense Forces|IDF]] service & playing in the Euroleague (Maccabi Tel Aviv) * [[Tamir Goodman]], US & Israel, 6' 3" shooting guard<ref>{{cite book|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=Jc4Kpu5UMd4C&pg=PA75&dq=tamir+goodman+jewish&hl=en&ei=fU8DTNnIPMH78AayzpX9DQ&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=3&ved=0CDcQ6AEwAg#v=onepage&q=tamir%20goodman%20jewish&f=false |title=Read & Understand Celebrating Diversity Grades 3â4|author= Martha Cheney|ISBN=1557997837 |publisher= Evan-Moor |year=2000 |accessdate=May 31, 2010}}</ref> * [[Yotam Halperin]] â 6' 5" guard, drafted in 2006 NBA draft by [[Seattle Supersonics]]([[Olympiacos BC|Olympiacos]]) * [[Amit Tamir]] â 6' 10" center/forward, University of California, PAOK Thessaloniki ([[Hapoel Jerusalem]])<ref>{{cite news|last=Pennington |first=Bill |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2002/03/17/sports/college-basketball-unrest-worries-an-israeli-at-cal.html |title=College BasketballâUnrest Worries an Israeli at Cal |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=March 17, 2002 |accessdate=May 31, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Popper |first=Nathaniel |url=http://www.forward.com/articles/5800/ |title=Hoop Dreams: Israeli High-scorer Shoots for the NBA |publisher=The Forward|date=June 11, 2004 |accessdate=May 31, 2010}}</ref>

===Fencing=== * [[Boaz Ellis]], foil, 5-time Israeli champion * [[Lydia Hatoel-Zuckerman]], foil, 6-time Israeli champion<ref>{{cite book|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=KSEkyUZOxG0C&pg=PA333&dq=%22hatoel%22+jewish&hl=en&ei=GUcPTc6CBYaKlweQzK3pCw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=2&ved=0CDQQ6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q&f=false |title=Yiddishe Mamas: The Truth About the Jewish Mother|publisher=Andrews McMeel Publishing|author= Marnie Winston-Macauley|ISBN=0740763768|year=2007 |accessdate=December 20, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=fiosdTntJz0C&pg=PA55&dq=%22hatuel%22+jewish+lydia&hl=en&ei=hkcPTfTSHMKblgeg16mLDA&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=2&ved=0CCoQ6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q=%22hatuel%22%20jewish%20lydia&f=false |title=Football for Peace?: The Challenges of Using Sport for Co-Existence in Israel |author= John Sugden, James Wallis|publisher=Meyer & Meyer Verlag|ISBN=1841261815|year=2007 |accessdate=December 20, 2010}}</ref> * [[Andre Spitzer]], killed by terrorists<ref>{{cite book|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=JMuCAAAAMAAJ&q=Spitzer+fencing+jewish&dq=Spitzer+fencing+jewish&hl=en&ei=73AHTJGlCYSdlge9m_CUDg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CC0Q6AEwAA |title=The Jewish athlete: a nostalgic view|author= Leible Hershfield|publisher= |year=1980 |accessdate=June 3, 2010}}</ref>

===Sailing=== [[File:Galfridman.jpg |thumb|180px|[[Gal Fridman]]]] * [[Zefania Carmel]] â yachtsman, world champion (420 class)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jewishsports.net/BioPages/ZephaniaCarmelandLydiaLazarov.htm |title=Zephania Carmel & Lydia Lazarov |publisher=International Jewish Sports Hall of Fame |date= |accessdate=September 28, 2010}}</ref> * [[Gal Fridman]] â windsurfer (Olympic gold: 2004 (Israel's first gold medalist), bronze: 1996 ([[Mistral One Design Class|Mistral]] class); world champion: 2002)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jewishvirtuallibrary.org/jsource/History/sailingtoc.html |title=Jews in Sports: Sailing |publisher=Jewish Virtual Library |date= |accessdate=May 25, 2010}}</ref> * [[Lydia Lazarov]] â yachting world champion (420 class)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jewishsports.net/BioPages/ZephaniaCarmelandLydiaLazarov.htm |title=Zephania Carmel & Lydia Lazarov |publisher=International Jewish Sports Hall of Fame |date= |accessdate=September 28, 2010}}</ref>
===Swimming=== * [[Vadim Alexeev]], [[Kazakhstan]]-born Israeli swimmer, [[breaststroke]]<ref>[http://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/jpost/access/99769140.html?dids=99769140:99769140&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:FT&date=Jul+02%2C+1993&author=JOEL+GORDIN&pub=Jerusalem+Post&desc=POOLING+THEIR+TALENT&pqatl=google "Pooling their Talent"], Joel Gordin, ''[[The Jerusalem Post]]'', July 2, 1993, Retrieved January 1, 2011</ref> * [[Adi Bichman]] â 400-m and 800-m freestyle, 400-m [[Medley swimming|medley]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dev.jewishvirtuallibrary.org/items/11985.html|title=Sports in Israel|work=Jewish Virtual Library|first=Simon|last=Griver|date=June 1999|accessdate=December 23, 2010}}</ref> * [[Yoav Bruck]] â 50-m freestyle and 100-m freestyle * [[Eran Groumi]] â 100 and 200 m backstroke, 100-m [[Butterfly stroke|butterfly]] * [[Michael Halika|Michael "Miki" Halika]] â 200-m butterfly, 200- and 400-m individual medley * [[Judith Haspel]] (born "Judith Deutsch"), Austrian-born Israeli; held every Austrian women's middle and long distance freestyle record in 1935; refused to represent Austria in 1936 Summer Olympics along with Ruth Langer and Lucie Goldner, protesting Hitler, stating, "I refuse to enter a contest in a land which so shamefully persecutes my people."<ref>[http://www.theage.com.au/news/film/diving-into-troubled-waters/2005/11/23/1132703244697.html "Diving into troubled waters"], Paul Kalina, ''The Age'', November 24, 2005, Retrieved January 1, 2011</ref> * [[Dan Kutler]], US-born Israeli; 100-m butterfly, 4Ã100-m medley relay<ref>[http://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/jpost/access/62544619.html?dids=62544619:62544619&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:FT&date=Oct+08%2C+1995&author=HEATHER+CHAIT&pub=Jerusalem+Post&desc=American+%27amphibious+creature%27+dives+right+in&pqatl=google "American 'amphibious creature' dives right in"], Heather Chait, ''The Jerusalem Post'', October 8, 1995, Retrieved January 1, 2011</ref> * [[Keren Leibovitch]], Paralympic swimmer, 4x-gold-medal-winner, 100-m backstroke, 50- and 100-m freestyle, 200-m individual medley * [[Tal Stricker]] â 100- and 200-m breaststroke, 4Ã100-m medley relay<ref>{{cite web|url=http://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/jpost/access/60647336.html?dids=60647336:60647336&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:FT&date=Sep+19%2C+2000&author=VIVA+SARAH+PRESS&pub=Jerusalem+Post&desc=Orbach+falters+in+bid+for+medal&pqatl=google |title=Orbach falters in bid for medal|publisher=The Jerusalem Post|date=September 19, 2000|author=Viva Sarah Press |accessdate=December 24, 2010}}</ref> * [[Eithan Urbach]] â backstroke swimmer, European championship silver & bronze; 100-m backstroke<ref>[http://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/USAToday/access/16397422.html?dids=16397422:16397422&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:FT&type=current&date=Jul+20%2C+1996&author=&pub=USA+TODAY+(pre-1997+Fulltext)&desc=Synchro+team+strength+wows+Cabinet+members&pqatl=google "Synchro team strength wows Cabinet members"], ''[[USA Today]]'', July 20, 1996, Retrieved January 1, 2011</ref>
===Tennis=== [[File:ShaharPeer.jpg|thumb|180px|[[Shahar Pe'er]]]] * [[Noam Behr]]<ref name="jewishvirtuallibrary10">{{cite web|url=http://www.jewishvirtuallibrary.org/jsource/History/tennistoc.html |title=Jews in Sports: Tennis|publisher=Jewish Virtual Library |date= |accessdate=May 25, 2010}}</ref> * [[Ilana Berger]]<ref>[http://docs.newsbank.com/g/GooglePM/PBPB/lib00161,0EAF82F28D65C8B0.html "Evert Fans Haven't Seen Player's Last Wave"], Janet Graham, ''[[The Palm Beach Post]]'', July 23, 1989. Retrieved June 21, 2010.</ref> * [[Gilad Bloom]]<ref>{{cite book|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=TflZAAAAIAAJ&q=jewish+%22gilad+bloom%22&dq=jewish+%22gilad+bloom%22&hl=en&ei=GSIGTKH0DIL7lwf364juCg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=5&ved=0CDoQ6AEwBA |author=Morning Freiheit Association|title=Jewish currents |publisher= |year=1980 |accessdate=June 2, 2010}}</ref> * [[Jonathan Erlich]], 6 doubles titles, 6 doubles finals; won 2008 [[Australian Open]] Men's Doubles (w/Andy Ram), highest world doubles ranking # <nowiki>5</nowiki><ref name="jewishledger2">{{cite web|last=Blas |first=Howard |url=http://www.jewishledger.com/articles/2008/08/27/news/news10.txt |title= . |publisher=The Jewish Ledger |date=August 27, 2008 |accessdate=May 26, 2010}}</ref> * [[Shlomo Glickstein]], highest world singles ranking # <nowiki>22</nowiki>, highest world doubles ranking # <nowiki>28</nowiki> * [[Julia Glushko]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.juliaglushko.com/scarsdale.php |title=Israeli Immigrants Help Change View of Homeland |publisher=Juliaglushko.com |date= |accessdate=June 2, 2010}}</ref> * [[Amos Mansdorf]], highest world singles ranking # <nowiki>18</nowiki> * [[Shahar Pe'er]] (3 WTA career titles), highest world singles ranking # <nowiki>11</nowiki>, highest world doubles ranking # <nowiki>21</nowiki>
===Other=== * [[Alex Averbukh]] â pole vaulter (European champion: 2002, 2006)<ref name="jewishvirtuallibrary11">{{cite web|url=http://www.jewishvirtuallibrary.org/jsource/History/tracktoc.html |title=Jews in Sports: Track & Field |publisher=Jewish Virtual Library |date= |accessdate=May 25, 2010}}</ref> * [[Boris Gelfand]], [[Emil Sutovsky]], [[Ilya Smirin]] â chess Grandmasters (~2700 peak [[ELO rating system|ELO rating]]) * [[Michael Kolganov]] â Soviet-born Israeli, sprint canoer/kayak paddler, world champion, Olympic bronze 2000 (K-1 500-meter) * [[Marina Kravchenko]], [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]]-born Israeli table tennis player, Soviet and Israel national teams<ref name="jewishvirtuallibrary9">{{cite web|url=http://www.jewishvirtuallibrary.org/jsource/History/tabletennistoc.html |title=Jews in Sports: Table Tennis |publisher=Jewish Virtual Library|date= |accessdate=May 25, 2010}}</ref>
==Criminals== [[File:Zeev Rosenstein.jpg|thumb|right|250px|[[Zeev Rosenstein]]]] * [[Baruch Goldstein]] â massacred 29 Arabs in the [[Cave of the Patriarchs]] * [[Zeev Rosenstein]] â mob boss and drug trafficker * [[Avraham Hirschson]] - politician whom was among other things the former Israeli Minister of Finance, whom convicted of stealing close to 2 million NIS from the National Workers Labor Federation while he was its chairman. * [[Gonen Segev]] â Former Israeli member of Knesset and government minister who was convicted for an attempt of drug smuggling, for forgery and electronic commerce fraud. * [[Dudu Topaz]] â TV personality, comedian, actor, screenwriter, playwright, author and radio and television host whom committed suicide in August 2009 after being charged with inciting violence against national media figures. * [[Ehud Tenenbaum]] â computer hacker also known as '''The Analyzer''' whom became famous in 1998 when he was caught by the [[FBI]] after hacking into the computers of [[NASA]], the [[Pentagon]], the [[Knesset]] and the [[US Army]], and after installing [[Trojan horse (computing)|trojan horse software]] on some of those computers. * [[Hanan Goldblatt]] â actor, comedian and singer whom in 2008 was convicted of perpetrating acts of [[rape]] as well as other [[sex offenses]] against women in his acting class.
